snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo faces a choice: Appease offended party members by adjusting his style, or continue the hard-edged methods his supporters call essential to governing.
abstract: Fellow Democrats are openly criticizing New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo over his tactics and approach to governing and politics, calling them dismissive and domineering; they contend he is quick to engage in conflict within the party and too willing to enlist Republicans and donors as allies against fellow Democrats.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo faces a choice: Appease offended party members by adjusting his style, or continue the hard-edged methods his supporters call essential to governing.

headline.main: Cuomo Is Put on Defensive by Fellow Democrats Over His Style
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Is Put on Defensive Over His Style
